alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:54PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Etowah County through 745 PM CDT... At 654 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reece City, or 8 miles north of Gadsden, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Hokes Bluff, Glencoe, Reece City, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Gadsden Steam Plant, Big Wills Creek, Crudup, Keener, Black Creek, Gadsden Water Works, Northside and Wilsonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
